title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7823.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7823.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

For purposes of this Part, the terms hereinafter listed
shall have the following meanings: (a) The term acquire shall mean the submission of a purchase order for a passenger
automobile to a vendor of such automobile. Any such acquisition shall be deemed
to have occurred as of the date the master or other underlying contract was
awarded the vendor, or the date the purchase order was submitted to the vendor, whichever is earlier. (b) The term
model type shall mean the year of manufacture, make and model of a passenger
automobile, and the cubic inch displacement and number of cylinders of its
engine. (c) The term passenger
automobile shall mean a four-wheeled vehicle propelled by gasoline, gasohol or
diesel fuel, which is manufactured for use on public streets, roads and
highways, which is rated at 6,000 pounds gross vehicle weight or less, and
which is designed to transport 10 persons or less, including the driver. The
term passenger automobile shall not include: (1)
snow removal vehicles; (2)
salt spreader vehicles; (3)
garbage disposal vehicles; (4)
fire vehicles (vehicles specially
designed and equipped for firefighting purposes); (5)
police vehicles (vehicles used
exclusively for law enforcement work and equipped with the heaviest duty
available chassis frame and components, body mounts, suspensions and engine
components); (6)
emergency vehicles
(vehicles which are designed, appropriately equipped and used for the purpose
of carrying sick or injured persons; and civil defense emergency
vehicles); (7)
vehicles for the
handicapped (vehicles constructed or modified for the transportation of
handicapped persons); (8)
cargo
vehicles (vehicles with a seating capacity of five persons or fewer, including
the driver, which are equipped with a heavy-duty engine and transmission, and
an inside or outside cargo area, and which are used for transporting equipment
and supplies in the performance of regularly scheduled work
assignments); (9)
carryall vehicles
(vehicles constructed for off-road travel and which are so used in the
performance of regularly scheduled work assignments); and
(10)
revenue passenger service vehicles
(vehicles with a seating capacity of 7 to 10 persons, including the driver, which are used for the primary purpose of transporting members of the public
for a fare). (d) The
term public authority shall mean any public authority or public benefit
corporation of which a majority of members is appointed by the

Governor. (e) The term rated fuel
economy shall mean the combined city/highway average miles per gallon (mpg)
rating for a passenger automobile, as determined by the Federal Environmental

Protection Agency and published by the Federal General Services

Administration. (f) The term State
agency shall mean any department, board, bureau, commission, division, office, council or agency of the State. The term State agency shall not include public
authorities. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

7823.2

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
